subject: Re: quikscript.org + Unicode/PUA fonts
msgSnippet: Hi, Yes, I would like to make some sort of Unicode (PUA?) version of Suave. But my concerns are: 1. As I understand, mapping Quikscript characters to Unicode
messageBody:
Hi,
 
Yes, I would like to make some sort of Unicode (PUA?) version of Suave. But my concerns are:
1. As I understand, mapping Quikscript characters to Unicode is still temporary, since Quikscript does not yet have any officially allocated section in Unicode. So if and when Quikscript does get some Unicode space allocated, any font I create now for PUA/Unicode will become obsolete. I'll have to keep my old fonts active on my computer so I can still read the many files I've written with them. And it's perhaps not entirely rational, but I'm a bit paranoid about old documents becoming unreadable, if they depend on old fonts that I no longer use and I don't keep these old fonts up to date / compatible with newer software and operating systems in the future. (Perhaps I could convert old documents with that Adapt-It program, though I've heard it crashes a lot, so it doesn't sound reliable.)
2. This will require creating a new keyboard layout (in my case for Ubuntu Linux), which I haven't learned to do yet. And quite possibly doing this work over again when a saved layout is no longer compatible with future versions of the OS.
3. Creating the new font will be lots of work, especially because of the hundreds of kerning pairs that would have to be redone. I'm reluctant to embark on this task if my new font will just become obsolete.
4. I put a lot of time into making the Suave font, and I'm inclined to turn my attention to other projects for now.
 
Perhaps some of you have much greater insight than I do into these issues.
 
Be Well,
 
Scott
 
<<<< Scott Ellsworth -- phone 415-621-6148 >>>>
